meanings.sent1: The dysrhythmic beating of the drum confused the dancers.
meanings.sent2: The heart monitor showed a dysrhythmic pattern, causing concern.
meanings.sent3: The dysrhythmic ticking of the clock made it impossible to keep track of time.
meanings.sent4: The dysrhythmic raindrops on the roof created a chaotic melody.
meanings.sent5: The dysrhythmic dance moves of the robot were both amusing and awkward.

meanings.definition: Not having a regular or normal rhythm.
meanings.sent1: Her dysrhythmic breathing indicated she was struggling to relax.
meanings.sent2: The dysrhythmic sound of the dripping faucet kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The dysrhythmic chirping of the birds outside disrupted the peaceful morning.
meanings.sent4: The dysrhythmic flickering of the old lamp added an eerie atmosphere to the room.
meanings.sent5: The dysrhythmic flow of traffic made the commute much longer than usual.
